meanings.definition: A ptomain is a toxic organic compound produced by the action of bacteria on protein.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the ptomain found in the decaying meat.
meanings.sent2: The smell of ptomain from the spoiled food made her nauseous.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the ptomain in the expired milk gave it an extra kick.
meanings.sent4: The presence of ptomain in the rotting fruit served as a warning sign of spoilage.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of ptomain in the contaminated water led to a health alert.

meanings.definition: Ptomaines are formed in decaying animal and vegetable matter.
meanings.sent1: The farmer learned about ptomaines while cleaning up the decomposing plants.
meanings.sent2: The biologist explained how ptomaines contribute to the breakdown of organic material.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended the ptomaines were tiny, mischievous creatures.
meanings.sent4: The stench of ptomaines in the garbage bin was overwhelming after days of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The presence of ptomaines in the soil accelerated the composting process.
